text: Zečevo is a Croatian village in the Šibenik-Knin County, near the town of Rogoznica. It is located in the Dalmatia region. Zečevo became known widely known in Croatia during the Croatian War of Independence, when a Croatian volunteer army hit two planes of the Yugoslav Army during the aerial bombing, and one of the soldiers shouted triumphantly: "Both went down!" This moment was captured on video and was broadcast throughout the country. ==References== Category:Populated places in Šibenik-Knin County
title: Zečevo
